page.title: 17CATON GALA
page.content: The Caton Gala was first opened in 1939 by the Gala committee. The chairman was H.Muncaster. The Gala was advertised in many local newspapers. In the early Gala they had trotting and horse racing and musical chairs on horseback. After the Gala they had the annual dance. The Caton Gala was revived in 1984 and was opened by a local M.P. Mark Lennox-Boyd. In 1985 the Gala was opened by Fred Dibnah, a famous steeplejack. The parade marched down Brookhouse Road to Caton with about 7 floats carrying people in fancy dress. The Lunesdale Pipers were playing as the parade arrived at the cricket field at Caton. They had games to play like coconut shy and pick a key to win a #1 note. There were races, stalls and Morris dancers and a fire eater entertained the crowds. The whole village enjoys this exciting event.
